hard_constraints.description: To identify numbers that aren't prime, we first define what a composite number is. Think of it like this: a number X is composite if there exists another number Y in our set that can divide X perfectly without leaving a remainder, as long as Y is not the same as X.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: composite(X) :- num(X), num(Y), X \ Y == 0, X != Y.

hard_constraints.description: Now that we know which numbers are composite, finding primes is a simple process of elimination. We define a number N as prime if it is part of our starting set and has not been flagged as a composite number by our previous rule.
